basics.name: Zahra TehraniNasab
basics.label: Graduage Student Researcher at McGill University & Mila (Quebec AI Institute)
basics.summary: Graduate student researcher at Mila (Quebec AI Institute) and McGill University, specializing in  generative modeling. I have a strong background in deep learning, computer vision, and natural language processing.

awards.title: Mila EDI Scholarship - Women in AI

publications.name: Language-Guided Trajectory Traversal in Disentangled Stable Diffusion Latent Space for Factorized Medical Image Generation
RL4Med-DDPO: Reinforcement Learning for Controlled Guidance Towards Diverse Medical Image Generation using Vision-Language Foundation Models
Towards Reliable Human Pose Forecasting with Uncertainty

work.name: Mila - Quebec Artificial Intelligence Institute
work.summary: Working on generative modeling and explainability and their application in healthcare.
highlights: Developing fine-tuning methods for Vision Language Foundation Models.
Exploring latent subspaces in Stable Diffusion for controlled image generation.

work.name: EPFL - VITA Lab
work.summary: Improved state-of-the-art models for Human Pose Prediction.
highlights: Integrated predictive uncertainty into models (+2â€“5% improvement).
Maintained deep learning library with team of 5.

work.name: University of California Irvine (UCI)
work.summary: Joint research with Sharif University on food image and recipe analysis.
highlights: Developed a hierarchical visual feature extractor for predicting ingredients and categories.
Built a Graph-LSTM model for classifying food using recipe graphs.

work.name: NodeEffect LTD
work.summary: Worked on blockchain technologies and led peer-to-peer cryptocurrency exchange software development.
highlights: Developed an open-source commit review tool
Contributed to FSharpLint, commitlint, lnp2pBot, fsx

projects.name: Persian Spell Correction
projects.summary: Designed and implemented a transformer-based model for correcting Persian text spelling.

projects.name: Posepred
projects.summary: Developed a library for integrating and comparing state-of-the-art human pose prediction models.
